result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony Gipson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tony Gipson appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense needs to contact SPD. Case is passed.

***
Case recalled at 10:07 AM. Appearances remain the same. Defendant was unable to get ahold of SPD. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tony Gipson in court.  Attorney Samuel Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Criminal complaint read aloud in open court at request of the defendant. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/10/22 @ 1:30p
